graph.original_query: Project Overview:Generate a full, multi-page website for a cutting-edge branding agency named "Caster." The website should exude sophistication, creativity, and strategic thinking. It needs to be visually striking, highly professional, and easy to navigate, reflecting a brand that understands modern design.Core Aesthetic:Dominant Theme: Dark, minimalist, and modern. Emphasize clean lines, ample negative space, and a premium feel.Color Palette:Primary Background: Deep charcoal black (#1A1A1A or similar very dark gray/off-black).Primary Text: Crisp white (#FFFFFF).Accent Color: A vibrant, slightly desaturated teal/turquoise (similar to the "design" in the example, e.g., #00A38D or #009688). This accent color should be used sparingly for highlights, interactive elements, and key words.Secondary Text/Subtle Elements: A very light gray (#BBBBBB or similar) for secondary text, subtle borders, or dividers.Typography:Headings (H1, H2, H3): A bold, clean, modern sans-serif font. Think something like Montserrat, Inter Black, Roboto Bold, or Open Sans ExtraBold. Maintain generous letter-spacing for impact.Body Text/Paragraphs: A highly readable, light-weight or regular sans-serif font. Something like Inter, Roboto Light, Open Sans, or Lato.Navigation/Small Text: The same clean sans-serif as body text, but possibly slightly bolder or with subtle tracking.Mood: Professional, innovative, strategic, creative, confident, premium.Layout & Design Principles:Modular & Grid-Based: Content should be organized into clear, distinct sections, often using a grid system (e.g., 2-column, 3-column layouts).Asymmetrical Balance: While clean, incorporate slight asymmetries for visual interest, as seen in the hero section's text alignment.Ample White (Negative) Space: Crucial for a premium, minimalist feel. Elements should not feel cluttered.Subtle Animations: Elegant, smooth animations on scroll, hover, and state changes. Nothing jarring or over-the-top.High Contrast: Ensure excellent readability with the dark background and white text.No Empty States: Every section must be populated with meaningful content and visual elements.Image & Visual Sourcing:Abstract/Minimalist: Images should be high-quality, abstract, minimalist, or subtly represent concepts of branding, creativity, data, or connection. Avoid stock photos of smiling people.Color-Managed: Images should either fit the dark aesthetic naturally or be subtly desaturated/tinted to blend seamlessly with the dark background and accent colors.Examples: Geometric patterns, subtle light trails, blurred bokeh effects, close-ups of textures (metal, fabric), abstract cityscapes at night, digital art representing data flow or network connections.Placeholders: For this prompt, use abstract image placeholders ( tags with relevant alt text, or if using a generative model, describe the ideal image for each section).Required Elements & Functionality (Detailed for each page):GENERAL WEBSITE REQUIREMENTS:Responsiveness: Fully optimized for desktop, tablet, and mobile.Animations:Scroll Animations: Elements fading in, sliding up/down/sideways, subtle parallax on background images.Hover Animations: Every clickable element (buttons, menu items, images, cards, filter tags) must have a distinct, elegant hover effect (e.g., text color change to accent, subtle glow, border expansion, background fill).Cursor Interaction (Optional but Desired): Subtle custom cursor or interactive element on hover over large text/images.No Placeholder Text: All text content should be coherent and relevant to a branding agency.Accessibility: Basic accessibility considerations (e.g., keyboard navigation, alt tags).Performance: Optimized for fast loading and smooth animations.PAGE 1: HOME PAGE (caster.agency)Header/Hero Section (Inspired by Original Image):Background: Solid deep charcoal black.Logo: Top left, "Caster." (as in original image, clean sans-serif, perhaps a very subtle unique character or dot).Navigation: Top right, elegant horizontal menu bar.Items: HOME, ABOUT, SERVICES, PORTFOLIO, BLOG, CONTACT.Active State: The current page link (e.g., "Home") should have an active indicator, like the small teal underline from the original image, which smoothly animates on page load.Hover Effect: Each menu item subtly changes color to accent teal or has an underline animation that expands from the center.Main Headline (Left-aligned): Large, bold, white."Great design is the language we speak" (with 'design' in accent teal).Animation: Text can subtly fade/slide in on load.Supporting Paragraph (Right-aligned, matching original layout):"We are a leading branding agency. We lead the creative strategies and development process for our clients. Our initial product and strategy workshops will deliver a much better understanding of your customer's needs. We help brands to feel social by default optimize for generations of consumers wanting to connect with people with brands." (Use a slightly lighter gray for this text).Animation: Fades in after the main headline."Latest Works" / Portfolio Teaser Section:Section Title (Left-aligned): "Latest Works" (white, slightly smaller than main headline).Filter Tags (Right-aligned, matching original layout):"All / Branding / Identity / Print" (or similar categories).Hover Effect: Each tag changes color to accent teal on hover.Active State: The active filter tag (e.g., "All") should be in accent teal.Portfolio Grid: Display 3-4 prominent portfolio items as interactive cards.Each Card: A dark-themed placeholder image (e.g., a dark rectangle with a subtle gradient or abstract pattern), with a project title and category overlay on hover.Hover Effect: Image darkens slightly, project title/category appears or brightens, a border animates, or the card slightly scales up.Animation: Cards fade in or slide up from bottom sequentially as user scrolls."Our Services" Overview Section:Headline: "What We Do" or "Our Core Services."Service Cards: 3-4 cards (e.g., "Brand Strategy," "Visual Identity," "Digital Branding," "Campaign Development").Each card: Title, 1-2 sentence description, a minimalist icon representing the service (design these icons yourself, clean vector style, perhaps line-based).Hover Effect: Icon subtly changes color to accent, or card background gains a very subtle glow.Animation: Cards slide in from sides or bottom on scroll."Client Testimonials" Section:A carousel or slider displaying 2-3 impactful testimonials.Each testimonial: Client quote, Client Name, Company.Styling: Quote text in a slightly larger, italicized font. Client name in white, company in light gray.Navigation: Subtle arrow indicators for carousel, with hover effects.Animation: Testimonials fade/slide in as they become active.Call-to-Action (CTA) Section:Headline: "Ready to Transform Your Brand?"Sub-headline: "Let's build something exceptional together."CTA Button: Prominent, styled to complement the accent color. E.g., "START A PROJECT."Hover Effect: Button background fills with accent color, text color inverts, or a subtle glow.Footer:Clean, dark, and structured.Company logo "Caster.".Brief mission statement or tagline.Quick links (e.g., Privacy Policy, Terms of Service - no content needed).Social media icons (e.g., LinkedIn, Instagram, Behance - design minimal, glowing on hover, accent color).Copyright information.PAGE 2: ABOUT (caster.agency/about)Hero Section: Smaller headline: "WE ARE CASTER." Sub-headline: "Crafting narratives. Building legacies."Background: A subtle abstract pattern or blurred image that implies depth and strategy."Our Philosophy" Section:A larger, multi-paragraph text block detailing the agency's core beliefs, approach to branding, and unique selling propositions.Break up paragraphs for readability.Visual Element: A complementary, minimalist image or abstract graphic that represents growth or connection.Animation: Text sections fade in as they scroll into view."Our Story / Milestones" Section:A clean, horizontal timeline or vertical list of key agency milestones (e.g., "Founded 20XX," "First Major Client 20XX," "Opened New Office 20XX").Use small, elegant dots or line indicators for the timeline.Animation: Timeline elements animate sequentially, lighting up or expanding as they are reached."The Team" Section:Grid of 4-6 key team members.Each Member Card: Placeholder image for a person (e.g., a simple grayscale face icon, or if generative, describe a professional headshot with minimal background), Name, Title, and a very brief (1-2 sentence) bio highlighting their expertise.Hover Effect: Image subtly zooms, or name/title appears with a background overlay."Our Values" Section:3-4 concise values (e.g., "Collaboration," "Innovation," "Integrity," "Impact").Each value with a short description and a small, minimal icon (design yourself, line-based, accent color on hover).PAGE 3: SERVICES (caster.agency/services)Hero Section: "WHAT WE OFFER." Sub-headline: "Strategic services designed to elevate your brand."Background: Abstract image suggesting diverse capabilities or a network."Core Services" Section:Detailed cards for 4-5 major service categories.Each card:Service Title (e.g., "Brand Strategy & Consulting").A concise but comprehensive paragraph describing the service.A minimalist icon (accent color)."Learn More" button (links to internal anchor or just a visual cue).Hover Effect: Card lifts slightly, border animates, or icon color changes more prominently."Our Process" Section:A clean, step-by-step visual representation of Caster's typical branding process (e.g., "Discover -> Define -> Design -> Deliver -> Grow").Use numbers, minimal icons, and short descriptive text for each step.Animation: Steps light up or reveal themselves sequentially as user scrolls."Why Partner With Caster?" Section:Bullet points or a small grid of key benefits (e.g., "Experienced Team," "Data-Driven Insights," "Holistic Approach," " measurable Results").Each point with a small checkmark or star icon (accent color).PAGE 4: PORTFOLIO (caster.agency/portfolio)Hero Section: "OUR WORKS." Sub-headline: "A curated selection of our impact."Background: A visually striking but abstract image that evokes creativity or finished products.Main Portfolio Grid:Large, interactive grid of 6-9 portfolio projects.Filtering: Prominent filter tags at the top (All, Branding, Identity, Digital, Print, Packaging, etc.), consistent with the home page.Each Project Card:A dark-themed placeholder image (e.g., a mock-up of a dark screen, a product shot, or an abstract graphic representing the project).Overlay on Hover: Project Title, Client Name/Category.Hover Effect: Image subtly darkens, title/category text appears/brightens in white, and a border/glow in accent color appears.Click Action: Clicking a card should visually indicate a transition to a "Portfolio Single" page (even if not built as a separate page, the intent should be clear visually, e.g., a full-screen overlay or subtle zoom-out effect).Animation: Grid items subtly fade/slide in as they appear in the viewport."Load More" Button: If more projects exist, a button at the bottom of the grid.Hover Effect: Standard button hover.PAGE 5: BLOG (caster.agency/blog)Hero Section: "INSIGHTS & IDEAS." Sub-headline: "Stay updated with the latest in branding and design."Background: An image that suggests knowledge, reading, or conceptual thought.Blog Post List:Grid or list of recent blog posts (3-5 items).Each Post Card:Dark-themed placeholder image (e.g., an abstract graphic, a subtle texture, or a digital illustration).Post Title (bold, white).Short Excerpt (light gray text, 2-3 lines).Date of Post."Read More" link/button (accent color on hover).Hover Effect: Card slightly lifts, image subtly brightens, or a subtle border animates.Sidebar (Optional but preferred for blogs):"Categories" section with clickable category tags (e.g., "Brand Strategy," "UI/UX," "Marketing," "Trends")."Recent Posts" widget with 3-4 titles."Search" bar (minimalist, dark-themed).Pagination: Simple "Previous" / "Next" or numbered pagination below the posts.PAGE 6: CONTACT (caster.agency/contact)Hero Section: "LET'S CONNECT." Sub-headline: "Reach out to discuss your next branding challenge."Background: A clean, minimalist image suggesting communication, a network, or a blank canvas.Contact Form:Prominent, dark-themed, and elegant form.Fields: Name, Email, Company (Optional), Service of Interest (Dropdown/Checkboxes), Message.Input Field Styling: Clean white text input, subtle light gray border that changes to accent color on focus.Submit Button: Prominent, accent-colored background with white text, strong hover effect.Contact Information Section:Address (e.g., "Caster. Global HQ, 123 Branding Ave, Design City, CA 90210").Phone Number.Email Address (clickable, accent color on hover).Social Media Links: Consistent icons (accent color on hover).Map Integration (Conceptual):A dark-themed placeholder for a map (e.g., a dark, abstract image that looks like a map area, with a pinpoint icon in accent color). No actual Google Maps API integration needed, just the visual representation."Schedule a Call" Button: Another CTA in case the form is not preferred.MANDATORY HINTS FOR THE AGENT:Consistency is Key: Ensure the color palette, typography, button styles, and animation timings are absolutely consistent across all pages.Balance & Hierarchy: Use font sizes, weights, and negative space to establish a clear visual hierarchy of information.Subtle Interactivity: Every interactive element should provide immediate, elegant feedback.Pixel Perfect: Aim for precise alignment and spacing.Brand Voice: The design should communicate professionalism, creativity, and strategic thinking without needing excessive text.DO NOT CALL FORMATTERAGENT OR DISTILLER AGENT IN THE END.

T001.initial_thoughts: Okay, I need to create the basic HTML structure and CSS for a multi-page website with a dark minimalist theme. I will create separate HTML files for each page (Home, About, Services, Portfolio, Blog, Contact) and one CSS file to store all the styles. I will make sure to include placeholders and comments in both HTML and CSS files for future updates. I will use Montserrat/Inter for headings and Inter/Roboto for body text, as requested. Also, I will include links to Tailwind CSS and lucide-icons CDN. As I am creating these files directly, I am not using Python or AST.

T002.initial_thoughts: Okay, I need to create the Home page (caster.agency) using the HTML structure and CSS theme from the previous step (T001). I'll focus on the hero section, latest works portfolio teaser, our services overview, client testimonials, and call-to-action sections. I will implement hover effects on interactive elements and use placeholders for future content updates. I'll use direct file creation for generating the HTML file.

T003.initial_thoughts: Okay, I need to create the About page based on the HTML structure and CSS theme from T001.  I'll use direct file creation to generate the new HTML file. files.about.html:
Caster
Home About Services Portfolio Blog Contact

WE ARE CASTER

Crafting narratives. Building legacies.

Our Philosophy

At Caster, we believe that branding is more than just a logo or a color palette. It's the essence of your company, the story you tell, and the promise you make to your customers. We approach every project with a deep understanding of your business, your audience, and your goals.

Our philosophy is rooted in collaboration, creativity, and strategic thinking. We work closely with our clients to develop authentic brands that resonate with their target market and drive meaningful results. We're not just designers and marketers; we're storytellers, innovators, and partners.

We are committed to creating brands that stand the test of time. We focus on building strong foundations, crafting compelling narratives, and delivering exceptional experiences. We believe that a well-crafted brand can transform a business and create a lasting legacy.

Our Story / Milestones

2018: Caster Founded

2019: First Major Client

2021: Opened New Office

The Team

John Doe

CEO

John has over 15 years of experience in brand strategy and marketing.

Jane Smith

Creative Director

Jane is an award-winning designer with a passion for visual storytelling.

Our Values

Innovation

We embrace new ideas and push the boundaries of what's possible.

Collaboration

We work together to achieve exceptional results.

Passion

We are passionate about branding and helping our clients succeed.

© 2024 Caster Agency. All rights reserved.

The page should include a hero section, contact form, contact information, a map placeholder, and a 'Schedule a Call' button.  I will use a direct file creation approach. nodes.description: Set up basic website structure with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Establish the core theme, including the dark minimalist aesthetic, color palette (deep charcoal black, crisp white, vibrant teal), and typography (Montserrat/Inter for headings, Inter/Roboto for body).
nodes.agent_prompt: Create the basic HTML structure for a multi-page website. Include CSS for the dark minimalist theme with a deep charcoal black background (#1A1A1A), crisp white text (#FFFFFF), and a vibrant teal accent color (#00A38D). Use Montserrat/Inter for headings and Inter/Roboto for body text. Ensure the structure includes placeholders for the header, navigation, footer, and main content areas.  Create one CSS file to store all the above mentioned properties. Remember that this website requires the following pages: Home, About, Services, Portfolio, Blog, Contact. So add appropriate comments and placeholders in HTML and CSS files, so that it can be updated in the future.

output.initial_thoughts: Okay, I need to create the basic HTML structure and CSS for a multi-page website with a dark minimalist theme. I will create separate HTML files for each page (Home, About, Services, Portfolio, Blog, Contact) and one CSS file to store all the styles. I will make sure to include placeholders and comments in both HTML and CSS files for future updates. I will use Montserrat/Inter for headings and Inter/Roboto for body text, as requested. Also, I will include links to Tailwind CSS and lucide-icons CDN. As I am creating these files directly, I am not using Python or AST.

nodes.description: Create the Home page with a hero section, portfolio teaser, services overview, client testimonials, and a call-to-action. Implement animations for scroll, hover, and state changes. Ensure responsiveness.
nodes.agent_prompt: Using the HTML structure and CSS theme from T001, create the Home page (caster.agency). Include a hero section with a solid deep charcoal black background, the 'Caster' logo, a horizontal menu bar with HOME, ABOUT, SERVICES, PORTFOLIO, BLOG, CONTACT links, and a main headline 'Great design is the language we speak' (with 'design' in accent teal). Add a supporting paragraph aligned to the right. Implement a 'Latest Works' portfolio teaser section with filter tags and interactive cards. Include an 'Our Services' overview section with service cards, a 'Client Testimonials' section with a carousel, and a call-to-action section with a prominent button. Ensure all interactive elements have hover effects (text color change to accent, subtle glow, border expansion, background fill).  Make sure to reference CSS properties created in T001 and leave placeholders to update the content in the future calls.

output.initial_thoughts: Okay, I need to create the Home page (caster.agency) using the HTML structure and CSS theme from the previous step (T001). I'll focus on the hero section, latest works portfolio teaser, our services overview, client testimonials, and call-to-action sections. I will implement hover effects on interactive elements and use placeholders for future content updates. I'll use direct file creation for generating the HTML file.

nodes.description: Create the Blog page with a hero section, blog post list, sidebar, and pagination. Include animations and ensure responsiveness.
nodes.agent_prompt: Using the HTML structure and CSS theme from T001, create the Blog page (caster.agency/blog). Include a hero section with the headlines 'INSIGHTS & IDEAS' and 'Stay updated with the latest in branding and design.', a blog post list with recent posts, a sidebar with categories, recent posts, and a search bar, and pagination below the posts. Implement animations for card lifting, image brightening, or subtle border animations on hover.  Make sure to reference CSS properties created in T001 and leave placeholders to update the content in the future calls.

output.initial_thoughts: I need to create the Blog page (caster.agency/blog) using the HTML structure and CSS theme from T001. I will include a hero section, a blog post list with recent posts, a sidebar with categories, recent posts, and a search bar, and pagination below the posts. I will implement animations for card lifting, image brightening, or subtle border animations on hover, referencing CSS properties created in T001 and leaving placeholders to update the content in future calls.

nodes.description: Create the Contact page with a hero section, contact form, contact information, and a map integration placeholder. Include animations and ensure responsiveness.
nodes.agent_prompt: Using the HTML structure and CSS theme from T001, create the Contact page (caster.agency/contact). Include a hero section with the headlines 'LET'S CONNECT' and 'Reach out to discuss your next branding challenge.', a prominent contact form with fields for name, email, company, service of interest, and message, a contact information section with address, phone number, email address, and social media links, and a map integration placeholder. Style the input fields with clean white text input, a subtle light gray border that changes to accent color on focus, and a prominent, accent-colored submit button. Add a 'Schedule a Call' button.  Make sure to reference CSS properties created in T001 and leave placeholders to update the content in the future calls.

output.initial_thoughts: Okay, I need to create the Contact page HTML file using the HTML structure and CSS theme from T001. The page should include a hero section, contact form, contact information, a map placeholder, and a 'Schedule a Call' button.  I will use a direct file creation approach. I'll reference the CSS properties created in T001 and leave placeholders to update the content in future calls. I will use Tailwind CSS and lucide-icons CDN. As I am creating this file directly, I am not using Python or AST. I will ensure the color palette, typography, button styles, and animation timings are absolutely consistent across all pages.

nodes.description: Ensure consistency in the color palette, typography, button styles, and animation timings across all pages. Optimize for fast loading and smooth animations.
nodes.agent_prompt: Review the HTML and CSS code from T001, T002, T003, T004, T005, T006 and T007. Ensure consistency in the color palette, typography, button styles, and animation timings across all pages. Optimize for fast loading and smooth animations. Make edits to HTML and CSS to ensure there are no inconsistencies.

nodes.description: Final code review. Summarize all code files in a report.
nodes.agent_prompt: Summarize all the code generated in the previous steps T001, T002, T003, T004, T005, T006, T007 and T008 in a short executive summary.
